author: {'steamid': '76561198838868167', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 175, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1677275099}
review:
this game is a true hidden gem, basically it's a mix of 3Doom, Half Life and Prey but low cost;
in this game you will have to solve puzzles, fight zombies (?) and, at the end of the level, to complete a puzzle to enter in a portal that will bring you to the next level.
the enemies gets stronger and the game gets harder going on with the level.

it definitely worth your mo(m)ney.
c'mon, it's just 99 cents!

author: {'steamid': '76561198197284195', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 250, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 250, 'last_played': 1658956038}
review:
Redemption: Saints and Sinners es un FPS indie en el que debemos guiar a nuestro personaje a traves de 7 niveles resolviendo puzzles con el fin de escapar de la nave madre que tiene en su interior muchos pasajes sellados y algunos monstruos.

+ Llevaremos 3 armas, pistola, fusil de asalto y escopeta que seran suficientes para nuestra corta travesia (4 horas)
+ Se destaca su apartado visual, esta muy bueno y va fluidamente bien.
+ En cuanto a los puzzles, todo correcto, alguno que otro te quemara el coco un momento pero nada complicado.
+ El apartado sonoro es correcto.
+ Contiene cromos y los logros se completan al 100% jugandolo solo una vez.

- Los encuentros con los enemigos carecen de sentido.

Si te va resolver sencillos puzzles (que es el objetivo principal) mezclado con tirar un par de tiros, te lo pasaras en una tarde. ademas de que es muy barato.
No es rejugable.

review: Redemption is bad and boring, plain and simple. Gunplay is terrible because enemies take an ungodly amount of shots to kill, even with headshots. I don't  really have anything else to say about this game because I spent very little time playing it, and i'm not going to spend any more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138390796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1647998292}
review:
AVOID

this is not the worse game I've ever played but it is close, nevertheless it has some good features so let's start with that
-Good textures
-The tech puzzles are fun but kinda repetitive
-Nice level design

Now the bad
-Buggy and glitchy
-Horrible enemy design
-Combat is clunky and awkward, the weapons hitboxes are weird and damage dealing is a mystery and I finished the damn thing
-Music is repetitive
-And last but not least; I've seen more story development in 2004 flash games

author: {'steamid': '76561198043108500', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 767, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1613170523}
review:
A short simple puzzle game with some action. Theres really not much to explain here honestly because it is really short. Sad news is you cant really bind your controls how you want it but its okay because its really not complicated at all. You may or may not be comfortable with the controls but its okay because the gameplay isnt THAT big and 80% of the time you'll do puzzles. 20% of the time you'll fight monsters but its nothing major when it comes to combat. You start off with a pistol, and you get new weapons along the way. Pistol in my opinion is really powerful than most guns but others are useful as well when it comes to power or ammo capacity.

The game overall is pretty easy, and I gotta say for a cheap price its not too bad. Though keep noted the game isnt THAT amazing honestly. Feel free to give it a try if you got a chance.

Last note: You cant jump in the game. Good luck if you are getting it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028570547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2563, 'playtime_forever': 944, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 944, 'last_played': 1587945150}
review:
"Redemption: Saints And Sinners" ist ein First-Person RÃ¤tselspiel.

Als Spezialsoldat werden wir auf eine lÃ¤ngst verlassene Raumstation geschickt, die nach einem Unfall durch einige Sicherheitsmechanismen und Kraftfelder versiegelt wurde. Ein Signal geht von der Raumstation aus. Irgendetwas hat sich verÃ¤ndert. Irgendetwas stimmt nicht.

Keine sehr innovative, aber eine durchaus atmosphÃ¤rische Hintergrundgeschichte. Dumm nur, daÃŸ diese Geschichte im Spielverlauf eigentlich keine Rolle spielt. Sie ist lediglich das Setting, in dem wir durch RÃ¤ume gehen, RÃ¤tsel lÃ¶sen und Gegner niederballern. 

Ja, Gegner gibt es auch und das ist die grÃ¶ÃŸte SchwÃ¤che des Spiels. Sie sehen nicht nur aus wie aus nem schlechten Zombie-Asset Pack entsprungen, sie verhalten sich auch extrem dumm und nervig. Hinzu kommt noch eine wirklich unglÃ¼ckliche SchieÃŸmechanik, die kaum Trefferfeedback hat. Die drei ungenauen Waffen und die Schwierigkeit zwischen ihnen zu wechseln hilft auch nicht gerade. Dieser Part des Spiels ist einfach nur schlecht und dazu noch vÃ¶llig unnÃ¶tig und deplatziert. Zum GlÃ¼ck kommen die Gegner immer nur in leicht vorherzusehenden, abgeschlossenen Passagen. Dann werden wir in einem Bereich durch Kraftfelder eingeschlossen und ein Dutzend Gegner spawnen aus dem Nichts und rasen auf Einen zu. Diese Shooter-Passagen sind zu Ã¼berstehen. Oft liegt der automatische Speicherpunkt auch direkt vor diesen Passagen, so daÃŸ ein Scheitern ob der schlechten Mechanik nicht zu sehr ins Gewicht fÃ¤llt. Ich sage oft, leider nicht immer. Es gibt auch Momente, in denen wir lÃ¤ngere Sequenzen wiederholen mÃ¼ssen, bis wir wieder zum Kampf kommen. 

Und sonst? Sonst ist das Game eigentlich gar nicht mal so schlecht. Wenn man sich mal an die Steuerung gewÃ¶hnt hat, werden auch die Plattform-Passagen durch gutes Timing lÃ¶sbar. Dazu gibt es noch einige DrehrÃ¤tsel, Kugel wollen durch Labyrinthe gebracht werden, auf Konsolen gilt es Punkte in der richtigen Reihenfolge zu drÃ¼cken oder einfache Memories zu lÃ¶sen. Das ist alles nichts wirklich Besonderes, aber es funktioniert und unterhÃ¤lt. Vor allem auch durch die gar nicht mal so schlechte AtmosphÃ¤re. 

Die 6+1 Level sind ganz nett gebaut, allerdings insgesamt nicht sehr umfangreich. In 2-3 Stunden kann man durchs Spiel durch sein. Die Grafik ist Unity-Standard und insgesamt eher funktional, der Sound schwankt von schwach bis durchaus stimmungsvoll und satt.

Schade, daÃŸ der Titel nicht auf die Shooter-Passagen verzichtet hat, dann wÃ¤re ein weitaus stimmigeres und runderes Spielerlebnis entstanden. 

[h1]Wertung:[/h1]
7/10 AtmosphÃ¤re
5/10 Story
6/10 Grafik
6/10 Sound
6/10 Spielmechanik
5/10 Balancing
6/10 Spielspass

[h1]Fazit:[/h1]
Gute RÃ¤tsel, schlechtes Geballer.

[h1][b]6/10 Gesamtwertung

author: {'steamid': '76561197971359899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 414, 'last_played': 1587948301}
review:
Game is not completely bad, but quite boring ...

The tasks to do do not vary, the puzzles are fairly easy.
No secrets or achievements to find - 
just the switches and keypanels to get through the levels.
6 Hours to solve the game, 5 of them waiting for a creative change - 
that never came ...

The whole game is designed with qube/block logic,
Backgrounds and Textures are always the same ...

Oh , i forgot:
- not possible to change Keymapping or Mouse orientation,
- sometimes you just fall through the floor ...

review:
Un juego muy infravalorado. Vale que sus encuentros con enemigos no tienen mucho sentido e incluso que resulten tediosos en algunas ocasiones, pero estos combates no suponen mÃ¡s de un 5% de lo que te vas a encontrar. Este es un juego muy al estilo de "Portal", en el que tendrÃ¡s que ir solucionando diferentes puzzles para conseguir abrirte camino y avanzar a travÃ©s de los siete sectores de los que se compone el juego. EstÃ¡ muy bien optimizado y los grÃ¡ficos  son bastante buenos, tambiÃ©n hay que decirlo. Lo recomiendo si te gustan los juegos de puzzles y de comerte un poco el coco.


7/10

I've seen worse; you can tell that some effort went into making this, but that doesn't change the fact that, objectively, this is simply a bad game.
And I would be more lean if it was the developers first game, but it wasn't, it is their 5th game, it could've and should've been better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198184282673', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 213, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 226, 'last_played': 1576012502}
review:
Well, this game is a great example how indie developers should not make the game. Developers tried to do both shooter, puzzle and a bit of horror and they failed all. The game swings between being some kind of puzzle and some kind of Serious Sam and both of these are made very mediocrely. Puzzles are simple and repetative. and those which are not simple are stupid, because they just make you to search for the solution throughout the level. Locations are small, you are locked in them with lots of enemies spawning around you, there are only 3 weapons and shooting itself is very clumsy. As for horror, the only thing that makes you flinch is an enemy that managed to spawn behind you. 

As for the story and music, heh, there is none of it, really. Even good old original Doom had more plot than this game, because it at least has short text inclusions between chapters. which this game does not. Really, the only story is the description in the Steam, the game itself has nothing except dull gameplay.  

You may say that the price is low and game is ok for, but really... what's the point of playing it if it's just boring and repetative even if it is only 0.99 $?

author: {'steamid': '76561198059386074', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 147, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1568567043}
review:
Man kombiniere (bei mir alten teil) den DOOM 3 Knaller und den Ãœberraschungs Hit Dead Effekt ( auch im Goo.AppStor*)  und man bekommt fÃ¼r den Preis von weniger als einer Eiskugel und im Angebot noch weniger als eine einfache Tafel Schoki ein vollwertiges Spiel,das auch mehr als nur Gelegentlich zu spielen ist, bin jetzt zwar noch nicht durch,da ich es vorhins gekauft hab, aber es macht durchaus Laune. Die Steuerung ist fast alles auf Standard Egoshooter voreingestellt,diese lassen sich leider nicht beliebig umstellen,was aber kein Zahn abbricht, 
Grafisch gesehn ist es auch voll Ok und man bekommt sogar eine Taschenlampen Reflektion zurÃ¼ck, bietet auch nicht jedes Spiel,und das bei dem fast geschenkten Preis :)
ok, man wird tatsÃ¤chlich reingeworfen,da wo man Muni findet, spawnen dann Gegner, die mich an The Forest etwas erinnern und schmunzeln lassen, das Spawnen der Gegner hÃ¤tte der Entwickler ein gutes Tick besser machen kÃ¶nnen,und sei es nur,das sich eine TÃ¼r in dem Raum Ã¶ffnet (s.Ã¤hnliches Spiel wie Doom 3) oder Dead Effekt und Co. 

Von mir ein Dickes Lob und ich erhoffe mir,das noch ein Nachfolger nachkommt :) was vielleicht ein wenig zur Vorgeschichte des "in Raum geworfenen Charackters" beinhaltet, warum weshalb wieso man sich einfach durch knobeln muss, 

Die RÃ¤tzel sind tatsÃ¤chlich bissl Mau gehalten,aber fÃ¼r die jenigen die nicht so gern RÃ¤tzeln wollen, oder nicht soooo viele Mutanten tÃ¶ten wollen,ist dies hier durchaus alle mal zu Empfehlen :)

AnfÃ¤nger Geeignet ;) kann man nicht viel kaputt machen :)

Klarer Daumen Hoch von mir !     :)

review:

Wer sich Ã¼ber die RÃ¤tsel beschwert kÃ¶nnte das Gleiche auch bei Doom bemÃ¤ngeln. Die Speicherpunkte sind immer fair gesetzt und es ist nicht nÃ¶tig ellenlange Wege erneut zu gehen. author: {'steamid': '76561198308020997', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1555849445}
review: Eh, for 99 cents it isn't bad as a way to kill a few hours. The game has seven levels, each one adding a new enemy, and type of tool or puzzle to use in progressing through, Textures are WONDERFUL for the price you pay. Throughout the course of the game you get 3 different guns, a pistol, Assault Rifle, and Shotgun. Hit detection felt a little off here and there but overall it wasn't bad. my only real gripes with the game is that most all of the areas feel and look the same with little variation and that there really isn't a story or any logs/lore you just proceed through the bowls of a abandoned space station and put holes in monster/mutant/zombie bruhs. All that said is it the greatest game I've ever played heck no, but was it decent for the 4 hours or so and 99 cents I put into it, Sure!

review: I recommend this only if you have a computer that can handle the graphics. I did m best to put it on the lowest setting possible, but that still gave me choppy animations for everything. Buy it on a discount and see for yourself if it's good, that way you won't have spent more than a dollar.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966405949', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1540676111}
review:
The only reason I recommend it is because there's no neutral option. It's not a bad game, but it's not a good. If you can get it for free it's worth a shot. At like $1 you're getting ~4 worth of a game.

It's a short, repetitive game but for some reason I was compelled to finish it. It was kind of annoying how repitive it was, just because level 1-4 are all the same, then I believe level 5 added a couple new mechanics. The puzzles are all the same, you're trying to find a pad to unlock a door, turning off a fire, matching 2 of the same object, or blowing up a door. There's only 3 weapons and like 5 enemy types. The enemies are really annoying for 3 reasons: 1) you know when they come because the music changes. 2) they often put you in these very confined rooms with them and it's hard to avoid them, especially since they're faster than you. 3) as they spawn they can hit you before you can hit them.

The weapons remind me of Perfect Dark for N64 and sound like Goldeneye 64. The enemies look very low quality compared to everything else in the game. The vision obsuring they have at the top and bottom of the screen is annoying. You can't change the default keybindings. If you turn all the volume options down low, there'll still be things that are 100% volume, like unlocking a door, explosions, or the elevators later in the game. That was really annoying because I was listening to a podcast and then suddenly had my eardrums exploded.

author: {'steamid': '76561198376317844', 'num_games_owned': 777, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 269, 'last_played': 1531190905}
review:
This game is highly not recommended.  At first, I was okay with the basic gameplay mechanics but upon reaching level 4, I just gave up on the game.  The fight in the second maze was simply not well thought out.

There is no story within the game.  The only story you get is what is written on the Steam store page description.  Unbelievable.

I encounter some bugs in the game where somehow I fall right through the ground and die.  I have no idea how that happens.

The game has basic puzzles to get through to the next section of the map; although repetitious, I had no problem with it.  The only issue I had was that once I unlock a certain area, I can't find the area I unlocked.  The entire map design looks the same.

The worst part of the game is the combat mechanics and bad level design.   The enemies in the first three levels are either easy or normal.  As long as their are spaces to maneuver and clips respawn, this was fine.  Once you get to level 4, the difficulty jacks up and not for the better.  The problem with this level is that the player will engage in combat in a tight maze where there is little to maneuver and the player runs into dead ends.  What makes it worst, newer enemies who does bigger damages makes their appearance here and they can come in bigger quantities compared to earlier levels.  Unless you're a proficient shooter, you are likely to die here regularly.  If you overcome the first maze, the second maze section is by far the worst.  After several unlocks, one battle, and a couple of sphere navigation, you will engage in another tough battle in a maze.  If you die here, you will have to repeat this entire section again and that takes about 10 to 15 minutes.  The checkpoint is way too far apart.  There is no way to decrease the difficulty so casual players can at least pass this section of the game.

At the end of it, the game doesn't get a recommendation.  The price tag however is still okay.  For $1.19 or less players can still reach up to level 4 normally clocking 3-4 hours of gameplay.  If you're good, you can go further than level 4; however, don't expect much from the game.  There is no story you will see within the game, puzzles and corridors all look the same, and the combat is brutal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013593530', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 275, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 275, 'last_played': 1530473954}
review:
So I thought there would at least be a story line of some sort, but no you just play through several levels and thats it. mobs are not hard and the puzzles if you can call them that get really repetitive. 

That said its really short and easy to complete so if you want to add another 100% completed game to your list go for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030057273', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 341, 'last_played': 1605984673}
review:
Would not recommend anyone to purchase this one. Product is too raw. It needs remastering and fresh team for finishing the project. Maybe, the idea is not the worst, but... Too many "if there were...". So, step by step.
1. Graphics. Looks fine, but... It is some kind of the Unity Engine, completely without any optimization. Your FPS will drain starting from the first room. 5/10.
2. Gameplay if fair enough. Sometimes lags, for example you're unable to click a node in the electronic scheme puzzle, rotating buttons on the energy node remain inactive after activating and e.t.c. Also weapon switching doesn't work properly. I think this all caused by the Unity Engine. 5/10.
3. Special part: jumping. Completely disgusting. There is no jumping. Especially important for levels with flying platforms. -10/10.
4. Monsters. No comments. Only one word: shit. Who's the author?! -10/10
5. The plot, the story. Where is it? Even no any notes, audio diaries, archives. 0/10.
6. The ambient sound, music. Yes, the best part of this project. Makes some kind of impresion and keeps the atmosphere. 7/10.

Totally -3/10. Time spent for writing this not included.

author: {'steamid': '76561198196421290', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1514095516}
review: Absolutly horrible. Janky controlles, 0 story, lame puzzels, and no perril what so ever. Its never explained why you are where you are (or even where for that matter) what your doing, what your goal is, who you are. There is not a single line of dialoge. Even then the monsters are the same and easy to kill, the puzzles are elementary and have no purpose. The only possitive point is that one of the (2) monsters is kinda gross and thats just because it has a messed up face. To be fair I played through one level, but there are 6 levels in the game (look at achievements) and the first one wasnt even a good waste of time. Not even worth 50 cents.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019152900', 'num_games_owned': 1967, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 287, 'last_played': 1510609533}
review:
For 50 cents, this game is rather a pleasant surprise and is definitely worth that price. 


Pros: - Good mix of simple but repetitive puzzles/platforming and wave shooting. Just make sure to keep checking the walls for interactive panels!
         - 7 levels that each have something unique added to the basic formula (new enemies, new 
          puzzle items)
         - Enemies can be challenging at times if they bunch up on you, but never ragequit difficult.
         - 3 weapons (pistol, assault rifle, and shotgun) with frequent ammo drops that regenerate 
          over time.
         - Health regen
         - Graphics are pretty good considering the low price.
         - Easy achievements (simply complete each level to get them all)

Cons: - Landing hits on enemies is very iffy but not a major problem as ammo is plentiful.
          -No jump button, which makes platforming more difficult than it needs to be.
          - Checkpoints are not as frequent as they should be in most levels.
          - LIght ordering puzzles are very buggy
          - Weapon switching is extremely slow

author: {'steamid': '76561198054970010', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 390, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 390, 'last_played': 1510310797}
review:
I wanted to leave a review as I'm pretty confident, with only 89 current reviews; that the developer may see it.

Firstly, I like this game for what it appears to be. To me this game appears to have been created as a first real use of the developers core skills in the field and as such, represents a very well designed game given the basic coding knowledge present.

The assets used have reasonably high resolution textures and are high quality (except for the obviously hand-made red 'shootable fuse box' which sticks out as not part of the original asset pack used) and therefore they are, along with good lighting, at least remotely nice to look at, allbeit a little monotonal grey.

To be honest, I'm enjoying plinckering around flicking switches and the puzzles are not difficult (at least as of level 3). The combat is basic, but the wepon designs are great, the "assault rifle" is actually quite satisgying to use, albeit underpowered for some fights and the enemies are of good quality and are at least relatively well animated.

I bought the game for 50p (GBP) and I am getting more that I expected from my 50 pence worth - it's not the best game I've ever played, no, but it is certainly one of the better games at the price point and, provided you don't mind solving puzzles, will keep you happily entertained.

NOTE: In level 1 tehre is an obvious typo! See if you can spot it...:)

author: {'steamid': '76561198330518273', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1496436293}
review:
Overall,I like the game,it was difficult trying to hit the enemies(Though I ran all around to NOT die) but I found they looked pretty good,the puzzles(I am bad with them) were pretty good at engaging me and felt pretty fun. I didn't mind the controls,a bit odd that they couldn't be changed but I never change them usually,I found the lack of jumping quite interesting,I'm used to them so I like the change. I liked the first three levels(Sectors?) but sadly,I can't say anything for the rest since I can't play it! I want to play it so bad! I honestly like it,the story(None exists) is fun if you make one up,and lastly before I give my ending statement,I would like to say that I thought this would be like Doom and Portal mixed,it wasn't,it is like it's own thing

In the end,I see a lot of potential and some real good concepts here,I only wish the major bugs(Hitboxes being broken,Sectors causing crashes,general crashing,etc) were fixed or at least more rare,oh and MORE AMMO I can't stress that enough,I nearly died(died a lot more) because I had no ammo

My Rating: 3/5

author: {'steamid': '76561198014790227', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1503905722}
review:
I enjoyed the game, except that the combat completely ruins it! The accuracy, hitboxes and weird spawns are just messed up making the fights very annoying instead of some fun challenging combat. Sometimes 1 bullet to the head is all it takes to take down an enemy, other times you either shoot through him or he becomes a bullet sponge. The enemies clip into your hitbox (and eachother) making you shoot through them while they're quickly clubbing you to death (the mazes...).

- The graphics are decent, nothing really to say about that.
- The music is nice, I like it, it's fitting. There's not much variety, though.
- The puzzles are repetitive but I personally don't mind that. You can't jump in this game but it adds to the puzzle and platforming aspects.
- The keys are preset, you can't bind them yourself which is just horrendous... I have no problems with the way they're preset but other people may have. Keys should always be bindable in any game.

[spoiler]When you solve the picture puzzle at the end of a sector the picture pieces flip to their backside and the puzzle screen immediately disappears, I would've liked to be able to observe the whole picture. The developer should've made it contain a 'press R to close' option like in pretty much all the other panels in the game.[/spoiler]

All in all I find the game to be pretty decent, except that the combat totally ruins it... I got through the first 3 sectors without all too much annoyance but now I'm stuck in sector 4 because of a bad checkpoint placement causing me to solve a couple of slow puzzles and having to do 2 fights every time I die... Which is just very annoying considering the awful combat and thus my will of continuing with the game is dwindling fast.

I think that about sums it up. If you want to try the game then I suggest getting it in a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998056243', 'num_games_owned': 816, 'num_reviews': 430, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1503509375}
review:
At the start of the game I thought this was a neat small simple game, very repetitive and rough but with nice graphics (although the same assets are everywhere). I paid it 50 cents on sale I think, so nothing much to expect, also because the full price is 3 euros and I think the game was made by only one guy alone.

Anyway, sadly after 3 full levels the game is simply not interesting enough and the puzzles (mazes, switches etc) are so pointless that most of the time you don't know what to do. A closed door? A shield screen that has to be deactivated? Well you will have no idea what to do and you just have to look at every nook and cranny to find the right switch to interact with or the small panel that you have to shoot to open a certain door. I don't think the game is good enough to endure that kind of 'torture' and stress. Sadly I can't recommend it, although I had fun in the first two chapters.

Ein paar verpixelte Zombies und Oger (was anderes fÃ¤llt mir dazu nicht ein), die auf dich einschlagen. Die Story ist ganz leicht zu verdauen, da es keine gibt... Man wird einfach so in dieser "Raumstation" voller langweiliger RÃ¤tsel gestellt und lÃ¤uft durch Labyrinthe und GÃ¤nge. Ab und zu kommen Gegner aus dem Nichts, die man dann mit seinen 3 Waffen bekÃ¤mpfen kann. An sich ja ne nette Idee, wÃ¤re aber mit Story um einiges besser gewesen. Um fair zu bleiben: FÃ¼r das Geld (Habe es reduziert fÃ¼r 0.99â‚¬ bekommen) hat man in ca.5 Stunden ein "perfektes Spiel". Nur Empfehlenswert fÃ¼r ErrungenschaftsjÃ¤ger die gerne mal schnell ein "perfektes Spiel" hinlegen wollen!!!!

review:
The graphics are good. The storyline is awful, because there isn't any. The puzzle games were really easy. You can kill every monster just with a headshot, so it was annoying to kill them.
Anyway, the game can be kinda good if you're playing for first time, but....NO!
Buy PORTAL BUNDLE for 2.23 on the sales and play it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016913953', 'num_games_owned': 220, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1499521123}
review: Well, it turned out to be worse than it looked. In the first 15 minutes i was met with 3 identical "puzzles" that include platforms going left and right constantly and a pit with insta-killing lasers popping from walls and from bottoms of the platforms. Somehow you can drop down from a platform for no obvious reason. Monsters drop in like in Doom but without even half-decent teleport effect making it weird. And to top it off the area that i've seen was dark and that flashlight you're given doesn't help. Felt frustrating enough, so i decided to remove this game even though i can't get a refund.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968912787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1499423672}
review:
OK So the reviews left on this game are not entirely fair, let me explain why.

Is this game great?  HELL NO!
Is this game worth the price tag?  (50 cents steam sale, $2 otherwise)  HELL YES!

The graphics are not actually terrible, the gameplay is semi-addictive...  For 50 cents, no one has any reason to complain about the game.  For the $2 that most people spent, they could've seen the terrible-ness LONG before 2 hours of gameplay and got their refund, but they decided to press on - their fault...  This game is NOT WORTH more than $2.   Again, paying 50 cents in the steam sale, I'm actually pleasantly surprised as how 'good' it really is!  That doesn't mean it's a great game, but its DEFINATELY worth a few hours and 50 cents!

PROS:  50 cent price tag.  Not terrible graphics.  Not bad gameplay (poorly executed..).

CONS:  puzzles are too easy.  'combat' is laughable but it helps to break up the monotony of pushing random buttons and seeing what they do.  AUDIO - it's RIDICULOUSLY loud.  When I first looked through options and saw all audio options at half, I put them up to full - big mistake, I ended up leaving them at ~35%, and it's pretty poor sound quality at that.  There are some more but they're really not worth listing...

BOTTOM LINE:  To all these idiots who bought a 50 cent - $2 game and expected Skyrim:  Go to bed, kid.  SURE, there's no jump button (which really adds to the puzzles...)  SURE, you can't re-map keys (honestly 90% of the keybinds where my 'normal' keys anyway, so it works...)  and SURE much about the game is laughable.  In the end, if you're paying less than $2 for a game, you should expect it to be bad and just have fun with it!  

That's why I recommend this game.  (alcohol helps - I promise!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198026957581', 'num_games_owned': 824, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1492364402}
review:
This may be the absolute worst FPS game I hav ever played, and I have played quite a few.
I couldn't gt past 21 minutes of gameplay. Let me throw down:

1: The graphics aren't terrible. they are ctually pretty up to par with sme other idie dev stuff out there.
2: The controls are more sluggish than if you were trying to pilot a zombie in a diving suit using RC drones to move his limbs. Its fracking awful. Just the worst. Not to mention, everything in this game feels like it weighs ten tons more than it should.

3: The enemies (the only two types) have a lot wrong. a. The do not so much as spawn, as much as just freaking teleport into the room you are currently standing in. b. They do not so much as have AI as they just have one simple command. Charge in a direction similar to yours, get IN your hitbox, and hit you so that you cannot return fire or actual maneuver around to avoid getting bludgeoned to death. c. Soak bullets like they're made of friggin space dwarf metal.

4: The puzzles. Oh boy... lets not spend too much time here... but there are essentially three or four kinds of puzzles in this game. 
a. Flip card memory puzzles with easy to remember symbols.
b. point the lazer pillar at a target to power a thing.
c. put the ball in the hole and make the lights come on.
d. Jump from block to block while they are moving.

So all fo these suck pretty hard. But teh jumping is made quite hard given that YOU CANT FRUGGIN ACTUALLY JUMP YOU JUST MOVE FORWARD REALLY FRUGGIN SLOW!!!!. Like I said before... trying to move in this game is like trying to swim in a vat of cold molasses while wearing teh iron boots from Ocarina of Time and trying to drag 4 corpses with each of your limbs while wearig a giat fur parka underneath another, gianter furrier parka. 

This game sucks.
It was not wrk teh .74 I paid.
And Its not even worth the effort of going thru the refund process.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286200379', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1491, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1495663022}

author: {'steamid': '76561198010673682', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1489539157}
review:
Game starts out initially interesting, with graphics you would expect from an indie game. Approximately 5 sectors in it deleted all my progress and forced me to start over (so imo it wasn't worth my time)

Pros:
----------
You utilize your brain to solve puzzles
There is more than five kinds of puzzles 
Theres combat mixed in to your puzzles
Cons:
-----------
- Glitchy targeting/fps
-Sometimes you will get stuck falling through the map over and over again until you can quickly reset to last checkpoint or restart level before dying again.
-Possibility of losing all progress, which really isn't too challenging, is time consuming. 
-Graphics caused eye cancer, although I expected poor graphics.
-After three sectors you've basically seen every challenge the game has to offer
-Albeit there is more than 5 types of puzzles, they recycle endlessly after sector 3

author: {'steamid': '76561198152760885', 'num_games_owned': 17519, 'num_reviews': 481, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1483876039}
review:
[h1]Basic Information[/h1]
[b]Title:[/b]  Redemption: Saints And Sinners
[b]Developer:[/b]  Black Lime Studio
[b]Publisher:[/b]  Black Lime Studio
[b]Genre:[/b]  FPS/Puzzle hybrid

[h1]General Impression[/h1]
First Person Puzzlers are a fascinating mix of action and adventure and thereâ€™s no denying that in recent years thereâ€™s been a hefty stream of quality titles related to this subgenre.The Talos Principle and A Story About My Uncle, stand out in my eyes. Had plenty of fun with them. Itâ€™s unfortunate that the game Iâ€™m reviewing today canâ€™t hold a candle to those two. I know what youâ€™re thinking. How can I compare a couple of AA types (that also cost several times more than Redemption) with the purely indie title created by a dev team focusing on cheap games? Shame on me for abiding to some quality standards!

Iâ€™ve said it before and I shall repeat it over here. A price tag cannot be the final label of a video game, indie or not. There are countless examples of affordable games that offer a far smoother experience than a Triple A title can present on Launch Day. Innovation and creativity arenâ€™t restricted by a budget, if the developerâ€™s truly commited to his project.  Quite ironically given the title, Redemption: Saints And Sinners cannot redeem itself enough for me to recommend it, even as a cheap distraction offering Cards and Achievements on the side.

As far as gameplayâ€™s concerned, the puzzle sections really are the only ones truly worth mentioning. Simple puzzles at that, with no challenge at all, not even a timer to coerce you into thinking that you can actually fail the game. Itâ€™s far too easy and even the broken combat system barely represents more than just a flimsy hindrance between a puzzle and the next one. They all relate to flipping switches, coordinating laser beams, avoiding the same beams and the occasional classic rearranging of pieces to form an image-kind of puzzle. Lots of fun! You know whatâ€™s not funny though? Having platforming sections with NO JUMPING controls or even implementation. You literally cannot jump in this game and that is a feature that will cause quite a lot of frustration when having to pass ever-shifting tiles that if misstepped, will cause you to fall into a pit and get fried by lasers. I never thought Iâ€™d meet a game which implements platform sections while eschewing the jumping control altogether.

Combat is so bad, that it becomes good. Iâ€™m just kidding. Almost like that B-movie you keep watching for a cheap laugh. Enemy AI is limited to mindlessly charging in a beeline and wack their melee weapons at you until you die. You are equally limited in fighting them with a sidearm (or later on a shotgun or something, but who would have the patience to actually reach the late game levels?) and aiming at their heads since they seem like bullet sponges otherwise. Your foes are some kind of poorly textured zombies that seem to come in two â€œflavorsâ€. Yellow jumpsuit burn victim and his buddy, the bikini-clad pale guy. I bet the developer had more than a few laughs coming up with these two. Even more so after giving them their distinct sounds which forced me to dial down the volume, from all the sharp screaming through a microphone, combined with a repetitive metal song in the background.

Though it doesnâ€™t seem to state this after booting the game, Iâ€™m certain that Redemption uses Unity Engine assets. Had my fair share of Steam games using those digital resources and most of them are quite alright and fun to play in the end. If the game didnâ€™t look half-decent, I would have rated it below 40, thatâ€™s a certainty. Alas it runs smoothly with in-game effects such as flames, soft particles and general lighting representing a saving grace to an otherwise forgettable experience. It even features a built-in frame rate sensor, though Steam Overlayâ€™s own counter works just as fine and also has the benefit of not showing up in my screenshots. 

So while the game doesnâ€™t look particularly bad, the sounds and animations will make sure you quit with a strong impression. A negative one. My advice to you would be to either buy this when its price drops below a dollar or get it in an equally cheap bundle. Paying 3 bucks for it should be considered a sin by itself. 

[h1]Strong Points[/h1]
+ Unity Engine provides decent looking graphical details.
+ Interesting albeit simplistic puzzles.
+ Steam Achievements & Trading Cards.

[h1]Weak Points[/h1]
- Abysmal sounds and combat mechanics/animations.
- Repetitve and liniar gameplay.
- Somehow itâ€™s still overpriced given its lack of polish.

[b]Rating 45/100[/b]
 
[quote]This review was submitted for [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ImperialReviews]Imperial Reviews[/url], through the generous contribution of [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/redhillcro]RedHill[/url].[/quote]

review: Well. It is cheap for a reason. The thought behind it is cool enough, but the game is not good at all. After 20 minutes I had enough. Those infected humans, or what they are, comes running at you naked with a club in their hands, and just look poorly executed, design-wised. Did not need to play a minute more in order to understand that this game is not for me at all. Actually not a game for anyone who has a slight bit of standards when it comes to a game.
